analytic.title: The Relationship of the Peshitta Text of Second Samuel with the Peshitta Text of First Chronicles

biblStruct.note: This article reports on the preliminary results of an investigation into the character of the Peshitta version of 2 Samuel. Particular attention was given to duplicate passages (those appearing in both 2 Samuel and 1 Chronicles) in order to discover if traces of influence from the Peshitta text of 1 Chronicles can be detected in the Peshitta text of 2 Samuel. Nineteen shared readings were identified. In general, Peshitta 2 Samuel and Peshitta 1 Chronicles manifest a high degree of independence from each other. The small number of significant agreements suggest that the texts influenced each other during the period of their transmission.

body.bibl: Morrison, Craig E. “The Relationship of the Peshitta Text of Second Samuel with the Peshitta Text of First Chronicles.” Aramaic Studies 3:1 (2005): 59–81.
Craig E. Morrison, The Relationship of the Peshitta Text of Second Samuel with the Peshitta Text of First Chronicles, Aramaic Studies 3:1 (2005): 59–81.
